lines.text: If Susan's lying in a ditch, you can be sure it's a perfectly good ditch, with hot and cold running water.
If you're not going to be pretty, the least we can do is make you interesting.
Gazing around the dark, gloomy entryway of the house. "Look at this hallway, frighten Dracula."
Oh, I've forgotten. Take that away. That's out.
Don't tell me you're on the wagon, Susan.
No, not at all. It's something much more spiritual than a wagon.
You realize what you're doing? What you're promising?
I'm promising to give you up for ever, if I slip.
Even if it's only...
Even if I only last a day, or an hour. You win. I lose.
I'll tell him I don't approve of it in the daytime. All night's long enough for anything on earth.
Where did you get that hideous thing you're wearing?
They got it for me.
They?
The school did.
Oh, really, Barry. After all the money we pay that school to then neglect her appearance like this. You look all wool and a yard wide.
Mother, you're funny! And you look so divine.
Well, why not? I work like a trojan at it.
If you want to know anything about this glamour business, just come to your mother.
I thought you liked the camp.
Why did you think that?
I'm told it's a nice, healthy place.
If I get any more healthy, I'll die! I hate the camp, I hate it!
